p: Polysaccharides produced by plants and microorganisms have been widely studied due to their natural antioxidants properties. Three polysaccharides, namely exopolysaccharide (EPS), water-extracted mycelial polysaccharide (WPS), and sodium hydroxide-extracted mycelial polysaccharide (SPS), produced by Fusarium oxysporum Dzf17 from Guazuma tomentosa displayed antioxidant properties [ 80]. In addition, total phenol and flavonoids detected from the culture filtrate of Phyllosticta sp. displayed significant antioxidant properties. When subjected to the 2,2′-azino-bis(3-ethylbenzothiazoline-6-sulfonic acid (ABTS) and DPPH radical assays, these compounds exhibited EC 50 values of 580.02 and 2030.25 μg/mL, respectively [ 81].
